wikipedia_page.main: Lothian George Bonham-Carter J.P. (29 September 1858 – 1 January 1927) was an English cricketer.  Bonham-Carter was a right-handed batsman who bowled slow roundarm bowler, but with which arm is unknown, but he was one of the last cricketers to use this bowling style.  He was born in Adhurst St Mary, just north of Petersfield in Hampshire.

Adhurst (also known as Adhurst St Mary) is a hamlet in Hampshire, United Kingdom.  The settlement is within the civil parish of Steep, and is located approximately  north-east of Petersfield.  Lothian Bonham-Carter of the Bonham Carter family was born in the hamlet in 1858.
Abdy's brother-in-law Lothian Bonham-Carter, and nephews Stuart and Algernon Bonham-Carter, were also cricketers and distant relatives of the actress Helena Bonham Carter.
*Lothian Bonham-Carter, cricketer, was born in Adhurst St Mary
